noun.description: A long, green-skinned fruit with watery flesh, usually eaten raw in salads or pickled.
The climbing plant of the gourd family that yields cucumbers, native to the Chinese Himalayan region. It is widely cultivated but very rare in the wild.

phrases: he leaps up the six flights of stairs and arrives at the top as cool as a cucumber
How to be cool as a cucumber at the searing heat of 45 degree Celsius?
No, Mamma, it's not hot at all, it's as cool as a cucumber.
Trying to get him angry with an increasingly cruel set of stunts, our newly cool as a cucumber bandleader learns that staying calm has some sensational fringe benefits.
The man from Moscow, calm and cool as a cucumber, knocked him out cold.
origin: Late Middle English: from Old French cocombre, coucombre, from Latin cucumis, cucumer-.
